alert.note: Alert for Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN PERRY...HANCOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN BRECKINRIDGE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 443 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Hawesville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hardinsburg, Hawesville, Lewisport, Cannelton, Cloverport, Mcquady, Skillman, Goering, Pellville and Victoria Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
